review: CPK is a chain that is a must go. The fusion food here is very well put together. Food: we love the food here and the food can be customized to vegetarian friendly diets. For appraisers, you cannot go wrong with the Thai Crunch Salad (avocado substitute for chicken). Entree: tostada pizza & Thai chicken pizza (no chicken) Service: service is always attentive at this and KOP location. Ambience: the seating and lighting in comfortable

If you want a brief summary, scroll to the bottom. So... waited ~25 mins to be seated (party of 2) Interestingly, we saw maybe 4 or 5 tables that were empty. We were not sure why we had to wait that long when tables were available but that is fine. After being seated, we were ready to order since we decided on what to get while we were waiting. Guess how long we waited to get water and bread? another 20 minutes. Funny part is WE had to call a server and ask to get us some water and ordered food because I felt like we were going to wait for amother 20 mins if we didnt call someone. she "kindly" told us that she will take care of us as if she is doing us a favor... Interesting... but anyways, so we ordered our food, then the host comes to us about 5 minutes later asking if somebody came by... so we told him we had to call someone but we did order... about another 5 mins later, host comes out with bread and plates... still no drinks, no napkins or no utensils...  Food did come out. we ordered Spicy chipotle pizza (I think that was the name) and garlic fetuccine with shrimp. We thought... well food is here so let us just enjoy the food and get on the way. Unfortunately, fetuccine is cold... and the person who took our order...(dont know her name because she never told us) was no where to be found. another server came by asking if we need anything so we told her about the fettucine. she took the food back and brought it out later warm. the server (the first one) stopped by once and we told her about the fettucine but after that she did not stop by to see if we were doing okay or whatever until we were clearly done.  Pizza was fine, pasta was okay... but the service made me not want to stay and finish the food. i dont know whether somebody got sick in middle of a shift but it was a ridiculous visit. -------------------------------------------------------------------------- visited on sunday evening time to be seated: 25 mins time waited for bread: 45 mins time waited for water and utensil: 50 mins will I ever come back? Maybe at another location but not this one.

Absolutely worst service ever. Waited forever to get even water. And another long long wait. We did not have designated server. We had to grab random server to order. Food came out cold/undercooked.. recooked pasta for us but no compensation for that. Which we didnt even expect them to compensate. totally unhappy, disappointed, frustrated about this service and food..  My partner and i went in for dinner on sunday evening. We waited approx 25min to be seated. And when we sat, we did not get served and had to wait for another 15 mins. We eventually grabbed random server and asked for water. The host brought us bread without water, napkin, and utensils. Later, we asked another server to bring us water and utensils. And the other server came and received the order like she was doing our favor. We ordered pizza and garlic cream pasta. Pasta was served cold, undercook, totally not appealing. We had to bring up that matter to the server. Brought us warmed pasta. No water refil, no extra napkins, nobody came to check on us after that. It was such an unpleasant dining experience  we went in there with good mood for sunday dinner , but came out lousy mood... will NEVER return here EVER!!!!!
The service was terrible. Couldn't get water refilled and our waitress was MIA. Came in for pizza and it took over 40 minutes for a plain personal pizza so we left. Would never come back here.

Food was 4 stars, service about a 2. I was dining alone - and is often the case - they tried to put me at the bar (high top) and I asked nicely to please be seated at a lower table. They gave me one (it was not yet busy - early part of lunch crowd, and I know what a pain it is to seat a single) and then basically ignored me. That said, my $9.99 half BBQ chicken salad was delicious - I added $3 worth of avocado. I love their herbal ranch dressing. I will be back but next time with other diners.  Dining alone here is not fun.

For a chain, this place is pretty decent. I really love their veggie pizza with goat cheese, it's phenomenal and not grossly filling. The dough is good too-not overly crispy but not soggy to the point where I can barely eat it without it falling apart.  They have plenty of other yummy options on the menu too-my friend really loves their pasta dishes. I usually just get pizza though. It is a pizza joint after all :)

We stop here frequently, at least 3 times a month, for take out.  The salads are excellent and usually the thin crust pizza is good. Problem is, it's not consistent. The size of the pizzas varies from week to week, as well as sauce, cheese, etc.  The last visit was the worst. When we got home, we discovered not only did we get the wrong pizza, it was burned to a crisp. If they would have served this at table, it would have been sent back, but they trust you won't turn around and run back, after you get home. We could not eat 3/4 of it.  Where is the manager?

Everybody loves pizza, and pizza...and gluten in general...is what's on the plate here at California Pizza Kitchen.  We started off with their very tasty bread basket, served with an herb olive oil perfect for dipping.  Ahh...hot, fresh bread.  Tough to beat.  But wait...more bread to come. Our appetizers included their bianca bread which was covered with parmesan cheese and sage.  Delicious.  We also enjoyed their hummus which came with...you guessed it...more bread in the form of flatbread wedges.  Excellent hummus and as good as anyone else's, probably better. Dinner was...bread, but covered with mozzarella cheese, prosciutto, sauce, and sausage.  Yeah some call this pizza, but in light of the gluten overload let's just stick with bread covered with stuff.  Really, if you enjoy thin crust pizza this is good. We left completely stuffed with bread-based dishes, all of which were solid.  We then experienced the inevitable gluten crash causing a Walking Dead zombie state, followed by food-baby bumps the next morning.  If gluten is your thing, this is the place.  Off to the gym.

Got salads to go - full size, which is $14.99. They are smaller than a Wendy's salad. I don't know if the container was not filled or what, but never again. I will say that eat in is usually pretty decent.

Overall good experience. The food came quick, was tasty, cooked to order, and the server was attentive and friendly. A touch expensive in my mind, but nothing ridiculous. No special commendations or complaints.

First time coming here and I will be coming back very soon. The menu was full of choices and I decided to order the Mahi Mahi Tacos. OMG!! They were tasty and full of fish and toppings. The tacos also came with chips and salsa.  When you eat here you will not regret eating out. There are so many healthy choices to choose from! A huge plus is they also have a bar! I will come back with my family and/or friends and try the bar our but for now the tacos was a huge success and so tasty.

I like CPK in general, but this one is the best one around here. It's got outside seating, a long bar counter, and good service. They seem to change up the menu a lot, and the additions never disappoint. Obviously the original BBQ Chicken Pizza is a classic, but their entrees are good and worth paying a little more than a pizza. Fish, pasta, and salads are all worth trying. I've gotten catering here for work, and the driver showed up on time, set stuff up, and brought stuff I'd forgotten I'd need. Everything was hot even though my building is in Conshocken. You should get in the free Pizza Dough club for cash back. Definitely worth it. Since the kitchen is open, you know they're doing things correctly. A friend of mine has celiac, and they have a lot of certified glutton free options. The wait staff has always been friendly to me. Some remember me even though I'm not there a lot. Managers have always checked to make sure the experience is good. As long as they keep doing stuff this way, it will be.

I was very pleasantly surprised by this place. My father and I are big critiques when it comes to pizza, and considering this is a chain, neither of us were dissapointed. Mamma happily munched away on her margherita as well. My dad and I shared the white mushroom (I added chicken) and the roasted garlic chicken with carmelized onions. Those onions though. Hit. Them. Up. The crust is crispy and chewy without being too thin, and they were perfect size pies in my opinion (as in plenty to take home). We also tried out the hummus app with pita. The hummus had a very distinct taste to it which I could go either way with, but the pita needed work.  I also got fancy with the arugula, avocado, sundried tomato salad. I eat those things out of the jar, so yeah, it was delightful.  As far as the atmosphere I absolutely love the open circular concept. Our waitress was pleasant, helpful, and quick to refill my glass as well. Overall, I was very pleased and would definitely reccomend this place. Ill probably go for some pasta next time :)

I had gone in ahead to make sure there was seating available, since it was NYE, and though the hostess was not at the desk, I could clearly see several open booths and tables. After waiting a few moments with two other families I went out to get my companion who is in wheelchair.  We thought getting him in the narrow door that should've been the accessible option would be the hard part. He barely fit through, and the molding that went from cement outside to floor inside had a substantial lip. We pushed on with the help of strangers and got him in. That door is NOT ADA compliant. 4) By then the hostess was there, and my companion, told her that we were a party of two for dinner. She seated the family that was there before us, and came back and told us there were no tables and we'd have to wait. We had to get to a movie so we questioned this. The hostess told us she only had booths. I asked if he could sit at the end of one of these, but she said no, he couldn't block the walkways. At this point, I looked into the dining room and saw a plain table just sitting there. I asked "What about that one?" She looked at me and said, "That's a table for 5." There was no one behind us, no one walking up, no one pulling up in the parking lot. I said "There's a table we could use right there." She looked at me condescendingly and said "It's for 5." By this point, Ken, in an attempt to get us fed and to our movie, pointed out that one end of the bar had been lowered to accommodate a wheelchair and said we could just eat there. The hostess told us that was for takeout customers and she'd have to talk to her manager.  We thought that would help, but the manager was just as clueless. Ken had already left the desk and was wheeling around looking for options when she came out and told him those open tables were in a closed section.  Were two pizzas brought to a closed section that much of an inconvenience? Was it worth the discriminatory practices, the ill will, and lack of present and future business? This location seems to think so. The fictional party of 5 that may never have come was more important that my wheelchair bound friend and I. By this time, we had spent 15 - 20 minutes trying to reason with these poorly trained young women. We had to give up and move on. They weren't going to serve us, despite having empty tables, and there was nothing we could do. So we left. Sonic got our money instead and they were pleasant about it. I'm still angry at the injustice of it all. At this point I can only hope that California Pizza Kitchen does a better job training its people and making its restaurants more accessible to wheelchair bound people.  They should be ashamed!

We stopped in the other day after our meeting with Santa! We were way past our kids dinner time so we quickly ordered food for our 4 year old in addition to our drinks. Our waiter was super fast getting us our drinks and overall he took great care of us the entire visit. Our dinners included the wild mushroom strozzapretti, the BBQ chicken pizza, and a salad for my mom. My 4year old decided on Mac n cheese.  Our waiter brought us the bread which came with olive oil and some herbs, could have used some more there but it was a nice start. After a little wait our waiter told us the kids meal was coming soon but our entrees came out first. We still waited for the kids meal that we ordered more than 10 minutes before the adult entrees. This was the only issue with out dinner, thankfully our 4 year old wasn't feisty but, kids meals gotta come out first!!!  The strozzapretti was delicious but a little small on the portion. The image in the menu looked substantial but the final portion was kinda weak. The BBQ chicken pizza with pineapple (suggested by our waiter) was awesome and my wife loved it. Great pizza dough here! My mom loved her salad but who cares. It's salad.  Not a bad spot to dine if you're in the mall area. I definitely would try more of the pizzas, that is their thing after all but keep in mind it's not attached to the mall so if it's rainy or snowy you'll have to walk through the weather to get to it.

A pretty average restaurant with a great lunch special, California Pizza Kitchen is always reliable, but there are better pizza places in the area. I'll keep this one quick, as most people are familiar with California Pizza Kitchen. When I think pizza, I think New York or Chicago...not California. As such, the pizza here is just okay, but there is a great lunch combo - Lunch Size Pizza + Soup or Salad/Half Sandwich + Soup or Salad/Soup + Salad for around $10-11. I opted for the Original BBQ Chicken Pizza and the Super Spinach + Quinoa with Granny Smith apples, marinated cranberries and spiced pecans with our housemade vinaigrette. The salad was the best part - the pizza was a little burnt with overcooked ingredients.  Overall, it's an average lunch spot that's a little overpriced other than the lunch special. If you're looking fora a far better yet similar lunch special, From the Boot is a better option.

Ok where to start...This was our first time here. While the host forgot about us to the point where I had to ask him why he was by passing us?  Our server was slow and inattentive.. So why did we give it 5 stars?  It was a manager named Jessica. She saw we were about to leave and came right over to us. She not only apologized, she took our order and we were eatting in less than 5 minutes. The food was outstanding. And Jessica turned a mishap into a wonderful experience. We will definitely return to California Pizza. Thanks to Jessica

So the only reason I don't give it one star is the food was actually pretty good, but this complaint is all about service.  If you see the picture I posted on here, they did not bring me silverware with my chicken garlic alfredo, and after 5-10 minutes, I was given plasticware to twirl my pasta.  Really CPK?  Also, it took me 20-25 minutes to get refills on bread and water, and when they did, the water had no ice (then I had to ask for ice, who wants to drink warm water?).  I went and used the bathroom, and the men's room trash can was overflowing and had no paper towels, so no way to dry your hands.  I was very disappointed in my experience here, and the service/cleanliness of the place especially since when I got there it was about 6 PM and there was no wait.  I don't know how you run out of silverware.  I was informed afterwards by management they had plenty of silverware so I guess my waiter was just incompetant or lazy.  Either way, I was not happy about getting plasticware, poor service, and the condition of the restroom.  On the positive end, my wife's avocado egg rolls were good, and my meal tasted pretty good, although it was semi cold by the time I even got my plasticware.  It would have been much more enjoyable if everything was done correctly.  I would say the manager was a nice guy, and even the waiter seemed like a nice kid,  he just didn't know how to do his job.  The fact the food was decent saved them from 1 star, but I am really flabbergasted about the poor service and plasticware.

We've become regulars at the Plymouth Meeting Mall lately. This was our dinner choice recently.  It was a roasted garlic chicken pizza for me. It was a thin crust pepperoni for my wife. It was a kids meal cheese pizza for my boy.  They fulfilled my expectations. Those weren't terribly high in the first place I must admit.  Everything was decent enough. But I soon noticed that I liked my wife's pizza better than my own. Thankfully she never finishes hers. Just call me the human garbage can.  Plus, I'd say the wait for the food was longer than I wanted. Granted it was a fairly busy Friday, but not overly so.  It wasn't bad. It's just isn't a place I'd go out of my way for again.

First it wasn't crowded but my granddaughter and I were seated at a dirty table the host apologized and sent someone over to clean it. We had to ask for a child's menu. We ordered and bread was brought to the table but no bread plates. Our entrees arrived but we had no silverware. When asked "Can I get you anything else?" I responded "forks would be nice". She brought over just 2 forks wrapped in one napkin. I guess we have to share and forget about cutting your food. This location is not for us.

I'd say it's better than Bertucci's. The buffalo cauliflower appetizer was outstanding. Had the chicken club pizza. Pretty good. They added way too much lettuce/arugula to it, though. Like taking a solid pizza and dumping a salad on it.
My favorite pizza. Barbecue chicken !!!! Great atmosphere and great service.  Highly recommended
Decided to stop in for a quick bite to eat. Our server was Sabrina. She is absolutely amazing! Very friendly and polite!  I've never been disappointed with my meal here.

Food was great- service was bad! Forgot 2 things- my soup and my main entry. First time here and I think my last time! And everyone ate except for me!!!  I had to take it home cause we were already here for 2.5 hours!! Geesh.... They are so under staff - please hire more help....

This restaurant was an awful experience. It took way to long for the food to come. The food was mediocre and left much to desire. I would recommend not getting the pizza or anything else from here save your money and get a little caesars better food and better deal. Also the waiters dropped my friends pizza then laughed about it. After that they made him a mediocre pizza for him and did not give him a discount or any compensation for it. I would only recommend this place if you wanted bad food, rude waiters, and a long wait for food.

Way to slow on delivery of meal on Monday night with a half filled restaurant. Waiting 1/2 hour plus. I be watched the entire evening news broadcast. Now seeing food going to people came after.  Waitress explained in a sharp tone down two cooks.

I have to say, they make some damn good food here. I am very happy that I went here, instead of another nearby restaurant. I ordered a Mango Iced Tea, and a Thin Crust Jamaican Jerk pizza. The Iced tea was fantastic, and the pizza was as well. It was perfectly cooked, and all of the flavours combined absolutely amazingly. My father ordered an Unsweetened Iced Tea, and a Tai Chicken pizza on a Wheat crust. He had said he enjoyed his Iced Tea, and that his pizza was delicious. These emotions are the same with my sister and mother. Slightly Overpriced though, in my opinion.

I'm a fan of CPK in general. I've been to 4 locations across the country and they deliver a great, consistent product and I they are reasonably priced for the quality of ingredients.  On my last visit I had lunch at the Plymouth Meeting location with my daughter. Our server, Lauren was awesome. Very engaging with my daughter which I always think is a big plus when I dine out. I don't deviate too much from the menu and I ordered the half thai crunch salad. It's my favorite thing on the menu. My daughter got the mac and cheese. I tried to talk her into adding the edamame, but to no avail. Food came out quickly.  I will definitely return when I'm in the area. Great for lunch, dinner, and they often have some great drinks on their menu.

Our server was amazing!!! She definitely made this place better. She had great suggestions and was very friendly!! I got the sangria flight (our server recommended) and all of it was Soooo good!!!  The food was eh. Not the greatest but the rest of my party seemed to like what they got. I had one of the flatbreads, but tried my cousins spinach and artichoke pizza which was yumm! We also got these spring roll things that was amazing!!!! The best part though was the sangria flight! I love the idea of flights and I've only seen them in beers but was definitely super excited that CPK had sangria flights!! So exciting for a non beer drinker!

I visited the Plymouth Meeting location Saturday, June 17th, around 2pm. The restaurant was semi-full. I sat at the bar and ordered my usual Original Barbeque Chopped Chicken salad and the mac & cheese bites. Mu food order arrived before my water and drink order. Dana D. Thr Community Brand Ambassador was exceptional and a breath of fresh air!!! Although she's not a server, she is customer focused ans committed!!! Thank you Dana for thr GREAT service!!

Food is generally pretty good! Great place for something pretty healthy for between $10-20 with a nice selection of cocktails and beer to accompany a meal! I had the Moscow Mule drink tonight with the signature Fettucine dish. Was great, love the atmosphere, a pretty good value overall and very comfy/casual place.

Ordered 1 dessert online for take out. I showed up 2 minutes after the estimated ready time and then stood at the bar to pick up my order & waited 12 minutes without being greeted. Several employees stopped to see if I was being helped and proceeded to notify the bartender who never came over. It was an hour before close & the restaurant was pretty much empty...oh, and 0 customers at the bar. Left without my order.

For those who aren't familiar with CPK in general, they offer a menu of inventive "pizzas" (many with atypical toppings and sauces besides tomato), salads, tacos, etc.  The food is fresh and the recipes are somewhat creative, which makes it pretty good as this type of chain goes.  I'm not the biggest fan of their more traditional pizza items (the kinds that come with actual tomato sauce), but I like the Thai Chicken Pizza and the Hawaiian BBQ Chicken Pizza (to which I usually add bacon).  The salads are good, if that's your thing.  And, the pork tacos and fish tacos are both better than I would have expected.  Their bar is also above average... There aren't many people sitting there just to drink, but they have a good selection, make drinks well, and have some decent TVs around the area. The Plymouth Meeting location is a pretty nice one.  It's pleasant inside, they keep it nice and clean, and they have a patio with outdoor seating.  The service is excellent.  They're very nice from you're first interaction with a host or hostess through the moment that you walk out the door, and the servers are consistently capable.  Their weak spot is their take out.  They have a pretty convenient take out system, with a dedicated counter that's close to reserved parking spots.  They get take-out orders wrong more often than is really reasonable, though.  To their credit, their managers are models of how to appropriately take care of customers after mistakes, but it shouldn't have to come to that. If you're dining in, this CPK is a pretty safe bet.  For take-out, I would recommend checking your order before you leave. P.S., if you're planning on crossing the parking lot to the movie theater, ask them about their offer for movie tickets.  You can buy vouchers there to save a few dollars on your ticket.

Our wait was originally slated to be 30 minutes which quickly tuned into 3 mins so already I'm liking it. Everything was good but I felt the prices were a tad high and that might explain why I may not be coming back as often as I would like. The atmosphere was upbeat and the pizza was great. The server tried his best but we ended up seeing less and less of him as our dining adventure proceeded. He needed to be reminded three times for soda refills and more bread.

I really enjoy CPK both for lunch and dinner. The lunch specials are great and provide an ample amount of food for the price.  I've been to three different locations - King of Prussia, Plymouth Meeting and Bala Cynwyd and the food has been consistently good. I will say that the Plymouth Meeting location is by far the nicest though. It is very clean and overall the service there is above average. The menu offers a lot of different options from Salads to Pizza to Main Entrees. I've tried almost every appetizer at this point and cannot complain about any of them. Portion sizes are large and items are tasty. Last night I also had the Angel Hair Pasta with Spinach and Asparagus. It was truly delicious. The sauce was light but tasty and the portion left enough for me to have for lunch today. Our server Abby was great. She was very attentive and on point. Bar was a little slow as the restaurant was busy but that is to be expected. We were a party of 7 and I think the restaurant did a great job with both the service and food.

I don't think I've ever been to a bad CPK. Having said that, I tend to favor the Plymouth Meeting location over others. I've never been here and had a problem with my meal, I've ALWAYS had super attentive servers, and I've always left full and satisfied. My last visit to this CPK was no exception. I visited on a weekend with my husband after coming from the movies. My only issue was that I couldn't decide between the Hawaiian BBQ Chicken and The California Club pizza. I literally took 10 minutes just trying to decide between the two. I asked my server if she had to choose between the two, which one would she choose. So she says "why choose? Get them both." She then explained that I could get 1/2 of each on one pizza. That made my entire night!!! Both pizza flavors were so delicious that I may never order a different item at CPK ever again.  I wish I could remember my server's name. I would send her a "Thank You" card.

I love CPK! I go to this particular location the most and I love their Chipotle pizza! The sauce is great and it's a nice "quiet" (compare to other restaurant nearby) place to eat with your family. The service is always excellent and I'm more than happy with their reward system. I got free appetizer and 15% off! Make sure to sign up the next time you visit!
Lunch combo of breaded chicken sandwich and greek salad. Salad was good but sandwich was very average. A little expensive for the quality of the food.

Great food. Terrible service.  Plan to be here for an hour and a half once you are seated for lunch. I have no idea why but I've never been able to get my food and pay in under 90 minutes. Since most of us only get an hour for lunch, this tends to be a real inconvenience. Alas, the food is good and there's not many sit down options at this price level, so I always return.

Delicious food! Friendly servers. AMANDA the waitress was very friendly and accommodating and also informative.  I will admit the prices are a bit steep, but the food is delicious. I had some type of vegetarian soup and the mojito was nice, but a bit sweet.  I would advise to not go out on a busy Saturday night or weekend, because I feel it's a bit understaffed. Pros: Nice atmosphere, clean, full bar, great drink selections. Cons: No drink specials
Stopped in to pick up a pizza to go $13 for a 10 inch pizza??? It's good but it's not that good ,way overpriced And it took 15min to get it???

We had the nicest waiter!  We had the chipotle chicken and free fried mac n cheese( we signed up for points program).    It had that made from scratch taste. It didn't have that franchise pizza taste.  We definitely will come back to try another pizza.

The California Pizza Kitchen located outside the Plymouth Meeting Mall provides about a 3 to 3.5 star experience.  When we arrived, it was quite packed, but we were able to be seated within a few minutes of arriving at the restaurant.  We were placed at a booth in the center of the room.  Personally, I enjoy some privacy during my dinner to conversate without nosy people listening in and this restaurant doesn't provide this experience.  Regardless, I still attempted to have a nice experience with my girlfriend. We decided to start with the Crispy Mac 'N' Cheese, Half Caesar Salad, and the Bianco Flatbread.  I enjoyed the flatbread but the rest was okay.  The salad didn't seem very fresh and the crispy mac 'n' cheese was good but nothing to get excited about.  For our entrees, I had the Fish Tacos w/ Avocado and my girlfriend had the Garlic Cream Fettuccine w/ Sauteed Mushrooms & Chicken.  The chicken in the pasta wasn't good, the mushrooms were good, but the sauce was blandish and not as garlic flavored as expected from the description.  As for my fish tacos, I enjoyed the tacos but they were nothing special. Overall, the California Pizza Kitchen was an okay experience as the food was nothing amazing.
Well...they should call it California Cleanse...because after everyone ate here...we all got sick. Chipotle chicken and club pizza ??? No...let's call it gross pizza that I can't believe I paid for!

I always enjoy the food and drinks at CPK. I think it's a solid place for lunch or dinner but it is definately overpriced. The lunch specials are probably the main selling point for me to go back, the pricing is fair for the amount of food that you get. We came here for dinner last night because it was conveniently close to the movie theater and were very impressed with the food. The Mac and cheese bites were amazing and my boyfriend was still talking about the delicious crispy chicken sandwich after the movie. I also had the appleberry sangria which was presented beautifully and was yummy! In wouldn't go out of my way to come here again but if go back if it was convenient.

Went here with the wife. Got the BBQ chicken pizza. Nothing life changing. Wife got pasta of some sorts. Pretty decent.  However, I should re state wonderful customer service. Host and servers were very kind and for a chain they do have great variety and a great drink menu. That alone should be worth at least one more try!
Customer service is well Above and beyond! So accommodating and nice!!! Manager was friendly and sweet. After a long day; it was very welcoming.

California Pizza Kitchen is perfect for take-out, a date night, to bring your family, to go with friends, etc. I've never had a bad experience here. I'm vegetarian so it is hard for me to find restaurants with vegetarian options, but at CPK, it is hard to decide which items on the menu to order because there are so many great choices! Some of my favorites here are: the pea and barley soup (it's vegan, which is a bonus for me!), the white corn guacamole, the macaroni and cheese balls, the flat breads, and the spinach & artichoke dip.  Also, the staff is always extremely friendly. The food and service is always consistent. Another perk is: if you sign up to receive points every time you come, you can get a free appetizer :-)

WORTH THE DRIVE OVER KING OF PRUSSIA! Had an awesome dining experience with a group of 10 last Saturday night. Our server was extremely helpful and went far and above his requirement to help our group. Not only did our server exceed my expectations but the entire restaurant staff were constantly asking if we needed anything (major points in my book)! What truly impressed me was when the manager came out to our table outside and greeted us with 3 free flatbreads since it was some of our group members first time experiencing this location.  The manager treated our whole table like we were family and stayed talking to us for 10 minutes at least! Overall amazing experience and an amazing CPK location. Will definitely not go back to the king of prussia location and only go to this CPK in Plymouth Meeting.

With declining customer service at their King of Prussia location, I had sort of given up on CPK, but I was in the area with my son to catch a movie and thought I would give this one a try as we generally like their food. I'm glad I stopped in as we had a very pleasant experience. I decided not to go for a pizza this time and try something new, so I ordered the grilled chicken chimichurri with grilled veggies. The dish was tasty but that chimichurri sauce definitely had a kick to it, which did wonders for my sinuses! Unfortunately, my mouth was on fire a bit and my waiter didn't refill my water fast enough to my liking. Anytime a customer orders a spicy dish, they should be more on top of the refills. Other than that though, no major complains and my son and I enjoyed our meals. Next time my family gets a CPK craving, I will come here and not to the one in King of Prussia.

Love. Many delicious and unique options for great pizza. Salads are the best. Portion sizes are huge. A little bit pricier, but worth it for the food and portions. Kid friendly. Energetic and well trained staff. Always on top of their game. Roasted Veg Salad, Pear Gorgonzola pizza and anything with 'BBQ Chicken' in its name are highly recommended. Hate the takeout though. Wish they offered curbside. Having to walk inside and hang out in that 'closet' with full view to the service kitchen does not help to build up an appetite. Otherwise, dining in and on their patio is well enjoyed. We are a frequent visitor and will be back again soon!

This California Pizza Kitchen is clean, and sports an outdoor seating area. (Sure, it's facing a parking lot, but if it's a nice day, it's nice to have an option, right?) They have a spacious interior, and quite a bit of seating. Anyone else notice how low the seats are in the booths? For appetizers, we had their Sonora egg rolls ($9.79), wonton rolls filled with grilled lime chicken, roasted corn and black bean salsa, cheddar and Monterey Jack cheese, mild chiles, green onions, and cilantro. On the side was a tomatillo salsa with a slight ting, and a ranchito sauce that looked like Thousand Island. Pretty good, though I wish we had more salsa. We shared a personal-sized Hawaiian pizza ($11.99) - that's pineapple, Canadian bacon, Mozzarella, and their sweet house tomato sauce - and a half order of a classic Caesar salad ($6.49). Both are dependable, safe choices. Ismael provided outstanding, friendly service, checking on us often, and offering the dessert menu after the meal. (Sadly, we were full.) If you're a fan of California Pizza Kitchen, this location does fine. If not, your mileage may vary.

As a foodie I don't consider dining at chains much.  What a great evening!  Ryan the host was accommodating and professional.  We had a party of 14!  They treated us like family.  Service by Christine and Joy was spectacular.  The food-especially the piccata dish made by Jose was top notch!  We called the manager over to state how well the place was run.  How you treat customers and the energy of the staff is so important.  They earned 5 stars as did the food.  Great meals all around.  I've paid 3 times as much for less quality with mediocre service.  Cheers to this place!  Great work.

I had a really great dinner out with my mom at the CPK at the Plymouth Meeting Mall! Our server was extremely friendly and prompt, which started and carried the whole night in the right direction. The bread was warm and tasty and the olive oil was great. We each ordered salads, and chose to get the "half" versions because we weren't too hungry and it was still definitely enough for a meal. In fact, we were both full by the time we finished! I also had two glasses of sangria which was delicious!! I chose the Caribbean sunset which was the white wine version and it was sooo good. Next time maybe I'll try the other one. Overall the place had great service, a great atmosphere (comfortable booth and not too loud!), delicious good, great drinks and a reasonable price tag!

Food was good/satisfactory as usual. That wasn't the problem. The waiter was nice but it went downhill from there. I ordered a raspberry lemonade. That was a mistake. First, I was brought a regular lemonade. Then I asked twice for my original drink. I finally got then, and subsequently drank it. Then I asked for a refill. Big mistake. I had to ask twice, again. Then, he brought me a raspberry iced tea. Not a lemonade. I asked again. Finally, I was given my raspberry lemonade. It was a struggle. We had a total of 10 glasses on the table at one time, not including a heap of other dirty dishes. We weren't asked if we needed anything else throughout the meal. My pizza was also brought to me wrong but they fixed it quickly. They didn't really make it feel like it wasn't a problem though. Ultimately it was an amusing dinner. Food was alright. Drinks were a mess. Dessert was good for a restaurant. The concept of this place always confuses me but whatever.

Went here for lunch yesterday, and was not wowed. I have been to this location before for both lunch and dinner, and have had much better previous meals here. The waitress we had did not speak loudly at all, so I had to strain to hear her, and the restaurant wasn't that crowded or loud at all. She took our order, then went to go get our drinks. Our appetizers came, and she was nowhere to be found to ask how they were. I ordered the Baked Mac N Cheese, which I love, so I would've been more than happy to tell her how good it was. Our entrees came, and again the waitress was nowhere to be found. Once to come and ask if everything came out ok, and then another time to ask how everything was - both times, no one came. The other pet peeve I have is the empty dishes and glasses left on the table. We still had both of our appetizer dishes and empty glasses from our first round of iced tea. This experience has soured my opinion of this restaurant, not sure when I'll go back.

This place can get pretty busy on a Friday or Saturday night. They have plenty of options for kids and adults. They have some funky pizzas as you may know as it is a chain. Sometimes the service staff can get stretched a little thin when busy.  Overall it's about what you would expect from a well-known restaurant.

This place is more of a 3.5 but since there aren't half stars, I decided to go with a solid 3 only because it's a chain. First of all, some must-eat appetizers are the lettuce wraps and/or spring rolls, which come in three flavors that are all equally delicious! Secondly, their name is "pizza kitchen" so yes, their pizza is pretty good. I wouldn't say it's anything super unique or crazy good because I know some other smaller (non-chain) pizza places do what CPK does and make "gourmet" pizzas, but they are pretty decent and worth it because the prices are decent! Another favorite of mine is their flavored iced teas. Nothing special because I think they just pump syrup into fresh iced tea, but it tastes so good!! (Sometimes they make it too sweet, but just add some water to suit your taste.) Overall, it's a great affordable restaurant that you won't be disappointed with!

The flavored fruit ice teas are so delicious it is a MUST to get them. They're naturally sweet but not too sweet. I drink about 4 of them when I visit. The pizzas are amazing and getting thin crusted is even better if you want a lighter option. I recommend always getting the truffle oil to go over your pizza as well. Service is typically on top as well, with friendly staff and fast service.

Great customer service when you do get it. A pretty descent wine selection and good cocktails. The prices are reasonable. This place is busy busy... My only hiccup is not enough employees at the bar. I waited for a bit to get my drink order in. The employees are pleasant and nice. The tv with sports on is a plus in my book. Ordered the Mac and Cheese bites for $3.99 (they were cold by the time I got them) and a Caribbean sunset sangria $8.59 which is delicious. I wanted to order a pizza but I was in the restaurant over 40 min and my main entree was yet to be put in. The manager did apologize and asked if I wanted anything. She was busting her a** to be the helping hand in the kitchen and bar but I didn't want to wait an additional 20-30 min for food. So I decided to just get the check and leave. They need more people at the bar because the waitress only focused on one section and neglected the other. Kinda upsetting. This place can definitely improve. Specially because it has the right employees working. I'll attempt to come back sometime.
Got the white pizza and it was pretty damn good. It's really nice in this restaurant. I'll be back :)

My friend had us meet her here--I was skeptical but it really wasn't all that bad. Kinda yummy in a 3-star way (better than some other chain restaurant food). The salmon in my pasta was actually really good and whatever veggie-laden pizza my friend had was cooked just right.   As for the service, our waitress forgot a couple of things, but brought them out right away and made sure to keep checking on us (and she was super sweet).
Friendly server, long wait for the high priced lackluster food. Will not be going back to CPK.

Food was good and service was great. I would def go back again. I had the the chicken salad which was ok but I also had the potato soup and it was delicious. Last time I had good potato soup was from Bennigan's which there no longer around. Will try the pizza next time since it is a pizza place.

Just waited 45 minutes for a pizza. Server was all over the place and took another 10 to get the check when it was clear that we were ready to leave (ie, we asked for the check whenever the pizza was ready). My husband pretty much ate his meal while I was waiting. Manager appeared to be wearing pajamas, which should have been our first red flag when we walked in.

This place is the worst.  Run. I ordered a chicken salad here and it came without chicken.  When I complained they could have cared less.   Guess what now I don't ever care to come back here.   Pitiful.

I honestly have never ordered anything here that I didn't like!  I ordered the hummus app, fish tacos (which are sooo delicious - definitely use the lime!), and shrimp & chicken lettuce wraps. Like other reviews, it did take a while to get the food... but i really enjoyed it, so I don't mind too much. I will be back!

After my meal at this location tonight, I was honestly shocked to see the plethora of negative reviews for CPK.  This was my first time at this location and the highlight was our wonderful server, Noelle.  She was extremely polite, attentive, helpful and accommodating. We started with salads for myself and my girlfriend, she got the thai peanut salad and I got the field greens.  She asked for no edamame and I remarked how my daughter liked edamame, so imagine my surprise when Noelle returned with a small cup of edamame for my daughter, along with our salads which were tasty and fresh. We got the BBQ chicken pizza for our main dish, my daughter had the kids cheese pizza.  Noelle suggested the honey wheat crust would compliment the sweetness of the BBQ sauce and she was spot on, it was delicious.  The only part of the meal that was a bit of a disappointment was my flavored iced tea, the flavoring was all at the bottom so it quickly started tasting like regular iced tea, which I like anyway. All in all we enjoyed the meal and would definitely come back to this location again.

This is definitely not the place for me.  I am a big fan of  "mom and pop" pizzeria's where you can get amazing food for a good price and you can see and taste the quality.  CPK reminds me a a factory that is constantly turning out food  in massive quantities without doing a quality control check.   I have been here a few times and feel that the experiences have been identical.  Long wait ( in a small area), service that is a snail's pace, and food that is underwhelming. My pizzas, even the marherita (which is probably the simplest one on the menu),  usually come out  crusty (in a bad way), congealed, and cold.  Not really what I want for the amount of money you have to spend.   On a positive note....this place is pretty clean (even for my crazy OCD standards).  I enjoy the way the main dining area is set up with high ceilings, bright colors, and funky accents.  Unfortunately, it is just not enough to make me enjoy CPK.

I am generally such a fan of the California Pizza Kitchens (no kidding, I squeal like a little girl every time we pass one and it's around lunch/dinner time). This one, was kind of a disappointment. The focaccia bread/sandwich was dry. The Chicken BBQ salad was good. The miso salad was only OK. I will probably go back just for the Chicken BBQ salad, but I was not impressed with the rest of the selections.
Has become my goto place for lunch and dinner after work.  Staff is friendly, food is always consistent.   Can't figure out why the rating is so low.

Stopped by for a midweek dinner with friends, and was extremely underwhelmed by everything about the dinner experience. There was no single operational transgression that detracted from the experience, but rather a confluence of minor annoyances: - we had to stand around in a crowded waiting area for 20 min - the service, especially time from seating to drink order, was pretty sluggish - the food was pretty bad: margherita pizza arrived semi-congealed, as it seemed as if it had been sitting out for a while. My $13 signature BBQ chicken pizza was also not that great.  - the tab was pretty high, given the quality of the meal I think the facet that made this meal bearable was the fact that we were with good friends whose company we enjoy. Had it not been for them, this would have been a pretty miserable experience. Sorry.

Based On the recent reviews, I decided to try CPK when the wait at Redstone was too long.  It appeared, again based on the recent reviews, that the restaurant had turned the corner. Boy was I wrong.  In fact, the experience was bad enough that I'm still sitting here waiting for the check and felt compelled to write this.  The restaurant was about half full with plenty of staff standing around talking so one would think that we would be at least somewhat well taken care of. This was not the case at all. We had to wait 20 minutes to have our drink order taken. Our appetizer (fried Mac and cheese) came out cold and the main entrees (pizzas, a BLT and a salad in stages). When we finished our entrees, our waitress came back (mind you she never check on our meal after she brought it) and stated,"you don't want desert do you?". Really?  My party had eaten our entire meal and to make a decision for us wasn't really very appropriate. We did order desert which ended up being the worst mistake. After taking our order, she left and disappeared for 20 minutes (not an exaggeration) for her to come back and notify us that two of the four items were no longer available. Ok, I get that but it took her 20 minutes to figure that out?  The two that came out shortly thereafter were melted (ice cream based) and one was entirely wrong. We had to actually get up and find our waitress after waiting another 10 minutes to get her to fix the mess up. We're still here 20 minutes later waiting for the check. we were just notified we are waiting to get "comped" for the butter cake we couldn't get because they were out. Unbelievable!  No "I'm sorry" or "I apologize for the wait". Nothing. ARGH! The only reason this review gets 1 star is that the food was fair (certainly nothing to return for regardless of the service). Overall this experience ranks among the worst I've ever experienced.  For the first and only time in my entire life I'm leaving without leaving a tip.

a day of shopping at the plymouth meeting mall not only landed me & my friend with solid halloween scores, it wore us out. we needed some sustenance, and stat! lucky for us, we had plenty of options on hand, tho we bypassed the [fast] food court, heading just outside to the crop of resties lining the parking lot.  with chain after chain [sigh] to choose from, we let our hungry bellies guide us, and into CPK we went. as it was a weekday afternoon, we were seated immediately by the friendly host and handed menus, along with a "small snack" menu - ya know, in case we wanted to order any quick bites while we perused the long list of salads & pizzas. um, can you say PERFECT? this was just what those hungry bellies needed! we ordered the chips & guac (with beans, corn & jicama mixed in!) along with fried mac n cheese, a recc from our server. both not only hit the spot, but were surprisingly good [for a chain] - esp those crispy mac balls! and these snacks came at the bargain basement price of just $3.75 each. noice. for our mains, she got the bbq chicken salad, a CPK classic that did not disappoint. i was gonna get me a salad too, until i saw the PEAR & GORGONZOLA PIZZA calling my name, and i simply couldn't say no. this tasty pie features thinly sliced bosc pears, caramelized onions & hazelnuts along with a blend of gorgonzola, fontina & mozzarella cheese AND is then topped with field greens in a gorgonzola dressing...so i did get my salad after all :)

Let me begin by saying I love CPK. I have been eating at their establishments for years when they were only in LA. So the fact that I am giving 2 stars is really tough for me. And truthfully, this location only deserves 1 star. Arrived 4:30 on Friday. Was with elderly mom. Took + 15 minutes to be waited on. Mom orders pizza. I order salad minus some toppings . Took 30 minutes to get food. My salad had all the items I asked to have left off . When server asked how dinner was I asked if he told kitchen no fried toppings. He stated yes, then said WHY? All the time I am picking wontons off salad. Do you want it remade ? WELL , YEAH !!!! Salad comes back yummy. Moms pizza yummy. Then mom wants desert. I order coffee. Comes out tight away, but no spoon. Server can't be flagged down. 10 minutes later I get spoon. Still no key lime pie. 1/2 hour later I tell server drop pie, want check. He states desert will be delivered in s second. 5 minutes later no key lime pie. Check please.  Server says he did the best he could. I comment over 1/2 hour for cold pie unacceptable . As we are leaving g manager appears with pie. Asks. Server which table . I comment probably ours have been waiting 1/2 hour for pie ! She offers to box for takeout but we decline. Box would have been another 15 minutes. My advice- go anywhere else unless you have unlimited time and patience !
Not sure why the reviews are low on this place.  Never had a bad dining experience.  Take out is dreadfully slow, but all the joints in the Plymouth Meeting Mall complex are the same way.

Found a shard of GLASS IN MY FOOD. It goes without saying neither myself or anyone I care about will ever eat here again. To add insult to injury, they treated it like a joke. I set-up a meeting with one of the manger's but he left. The manager I met with actually laughed while I was filling out the report. NEVER AGAIN will I have anything to do with this place. Really sad and disappointing since I really loved that veggie pizza. But taste does not rule out safety.

Run and run fast.  I went with 3 friends. We ordered soup, salad, and pizza. Everything came out at the exact same time and didn't fit on our table. Our waiter apologized and said that the kitchen must have been "confused." The margarita pizza was soggy, and the artichoke pizza was just plain gross. The night ended with 1 of our friends throwing up, and the other 3 feeling like they needed to throw up. Good times. Avoid this place at all costs.

I've said before that I don't mind paying for good food, but honestly the pizza here isn't good. I'd much rather go to Peace a Pizza or any mom and pop pizza place and save a few bucks in the process. CPK is way overpriced and just isn't quality food.

I've been to many Pizza places and I've got to say, they're one of the best!!! Their thin crust pizza is great! And while they're a bit expensive for my taste- $4 for a soda!, I think their lettuce wraps are better than the ones at P.F. Changs.  A clean restaurant with a nice outdoor seating area, this particular one is a bit on the small size, therefore when it's busy, it's very noisy. But they do have a very good BBQ chicken pizza. Their Pesto Chicken Pizza is one of my favorites. And they used to have a pizza with curried chicken on it that was quite good but they don't have it anymore.  Naturally, their chicken, pasta, and fish dishes aren't that wonderful. It's a Pizza Kitchen, so what do you expect?!?!? Their desserts are nice, I like their Tiramisu and Turtle Sundae.  Cheesecake Factory does have a bigger and better lettuce wrap, but the sauce that comes with the lettuce wrap at CPK is divine! You can order a pint of it for about $5.  Overall, I think they have wonderful pizzas, service, interior, exterior, and lettuce wrap sauce. They are consistently great which is why I will continue to go back. And, I will continue to buy their frozen pizzas at the grocery- they're half the price and almost just as good.

Food is decent but service is terrible. We waited about 40 minutes until our food came out. Waitress never checked to see if we needed refills, forgot stuff that we asked for. Won't be coming back again.

This is my families go to place.  From my 3 year old nephew to my 67 year old dad.  We all agree on two places CPK and Olive Garden and since CPK is only a couple of miles away this is where we come most.  To be fair we really like it all from apps to drinks and even desserts.  The only reason I took one star is that the staff needs to know the menu better.  I always go online and check but when in the restaurant the staff always says something different.  One of the pizzas we like has fish sauce in it so we request another sauce.  We are always to no substitutions and so then I explain about the fish allergy and every time I am assured their is no fish in the sauce.  I then have the staff ask a manager and without fail I am correct and they bend over backwards then to accommodate.  If it was not for that one hiccup they would have gotten a full 5 rating...

This place is "just ok."  I think it used to be better prior to 5 or 6 years ago before it got to be a really big chain.  I feel like they try too hard to come up with inventive pizza and pasta dishes.  Ironically, their original bbq chicken pizza is really still what I like to order.  Their wait time rivals Cheesecake Factory.  Quite frankly, the wait is more worth my while at Cheesecake Factory.

I have gone to this restaurant a few times since it has opened. Originally, I had no qualms with this place. The food was good and interesting enough, and the service was just fine. However, since my first visit, I have been nothing except disgusted and dissatisfied. I am a very patient and forgiving person when it comes to restaurants (seeing as I work in one), that being said, it takes a lot for something to get to me when it comes to dining out. The past two times I have eaten at CPK, I have had slow service. The food did not change (although I did have an unfortunate take-out incident with this place...but that's besides the point), and neither has my seat (in a smaller booth in the middle of the restaurant on the side facing the bar), and surprisingly enough neither has the horrible service. The past two times I have been there it has taken our server over five minutes to greet us. Each time our server looked as if they had just rolled out of bed with out a shower...or even a wash of their hands. They lack character and personality, and make the experience miserable. I do not intend on returning to this restaurant, unless if by some miracle their service improves greatly. The only reason I didn't give this restaurant one star is because the food is consistently OK.
